ticketpy package¶

ticketpy.client module¶

API client classes

class ticketpy.client.ApiClient(api_key)¶

Bases: object

ApiClient is the main wrapper for the Discovery API.

Example: Get the first page result for venues matching keyword ‘Tabernacle‘:

import ticketpy

client = ticketpy.ApiClient("your_api_key")
resp = client.venues.find(keyword="Tabernacle").one()
for venue in resp:
    print(venue.name)

Output:

Tabernacle
The Tabernacle
Tabernacle, Notting Hill
Bethel Tabernacle
Revivaltime Tabernacle
...

Request URLs end up looking like: http://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json?apikey={api_key}

Exception thrown for API-related error messages

class ticketpy.client.PagedResponse(api_client, response)¶

Bases: object

Iterates through API response pages

all()¶

Retrieves all pages in a result, returning a flat list.

Use limit() to restrict the number of page requests being made. WARNING: Generic searches may involve a lot of pages...

Returns:Flat list of results
limit(max_pages=5)¶

Retrieve X number of pages, returning a list of all entities.

Rather than iterating through PagedResponse to retrieve each page (and its events/venues/etc), limit() will automatically iterate up to max_pages and return a flat/joined list of items in each Page

Parameters:max_pages – Max page requests to make before returning list
Returns:Flat list of results from pages
one()¶

Get items from first page result

class ticketpy.query.EventQuery(api_client)¶

Bases: ticketpy.query.BaseQuery

Abstraction to search API for events

by_location(latitude, longitude, radius='10', unit='miles', sort='relevance, desc', **kwargs)¶

Search events within a radius of a latitude/longitude coordinate.

Parameters:
  • latitude – Latitude of radius center
  • longitude – Longitude of radius center
  • radius – Radius to search outside given latitude/longitude
  • unit – Unit of radius (‘miles’ or ‘km’),
  • sort – Sort method. (Default: relevance, desc). If changed, you may get wonky results (date, asc returns far-away events)
Returns:

List of events within that area
find(sort='date, asc', latlong=None, radius=None, unit=None, start_date_time=None, end_date_time=None, onsale_start_date_time=None, onsale_end_date_time=None, country_code=None, state_code=None, venue_id=None, attraction_id=None, segment_id=None, segment_name=None, classification_name=None, classification_id=None, market_id=None, promoter_id=None, dma_id=None, include_tba=None, include_tbd=None, client_visibility=None, keyword=None, event_id=None, source=None, include_test=None, page=None, size=None, locale=None, **kwargs)¶

Search for events matching given criteria.

Parameters:
  • sort – Sorting order of _search result (default: ‘relevance,desc’)
  • latlong – Latitude/longitude filter
  • radius – Radius of area to _search
  • unit – Unit of radius, ‘miles’ or ‘km’ (default: miles)
  • start_date_time – Filter by start date/time. Timestamp format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
  • end_date_time – Filter by end date/time. Timestamp format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
  • onsale_start_date_time –
  • onsale_end_date_time –
  • country_code –
  • state_code – State code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)
  • venue_id – Find events for provided venue ID
  • attraction_id –
  • segment_id –
  • segment_name –
  • classification_name – Filter events by a list of classification name(s) (genre/subgenre/type/subtype/segment)
  • classification_id –
  • market_id –
  • promoter_id –
  • dma_id –
  • include_tba – True to include events with a to-be-announced date ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • include_tbd – True to include an event with a date to be defined ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • client_visibility –
  • keyword –
  • event_id – Event ID to _search
  • source – Filter entities by source name: [‘ticketmaster’, ‘universe’, ‘frontgate’, ‘tmr’]
  • include_test – ‘yes’ to include test entities in the response. False or ‘no’ to exclude. ‘only’ to return ONLY test entities. ([‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’])
  • page – Page number to get (default: 0)
  • size – Size of page (default: 20)
  • locale – Locale (default: ‘en’)
Returns:
model¶

alias of Event

resource = 'events'¶

class ticketpy.query.VenueQuery(api_client)¶

Bases: ticketpy.query.BaseQuery

Queries for venues

by_name(venue_name, state_code=None, **kwargs)¶

Search for a venue by name.

Parameters:
  • venue_name – Venue name to search
  • state_code – Two-letter state code to narrow results (ex ‘GA’) (default: None)
Returns:

List of venues found matching search criteria
find(keyword=None, venue_id=None, sort=None, state_code=None, country_code=None, source=None, include_test=None, page=None, size=None, locale=None, **kwargs)¶

Search for venues matching provided parameters

Parameters:
  • keyword – Keyword to search on (such as part of the venue name)
  • venue_id – Venue ID
  • sort – Sort method for response (API default: ‘name,asc’)
  • state_code – Filter by state code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)
  • country_code – Filter by country code
  • source – Filter entities by source ([‘ticketmaster’, ‘universe’, ‘frontgate’, ‘tmr’])
  • include_test – [‘yes’, ‘no’, ‘only’], whether to include entities flagged as test in the response (default: ‘no’)
  • page – Page number (default: 0)
  • size – Page size of the response (default: 20)
  • locale – Locale (default: ‘en’)
Returns:

Venues found matching criteria
Return type:

ticketpy.PagedResponse
model¶

alias of Venue

resource = 'venues'¶

static from_json(json_obj)¶
class ticketpy.model.Event(additional_info=None, attractions=None, classifications=None, dates=None, description=None, distance=None, event_id=None, images=None, info=None, links=None, locale=None, name=None, test=None, place=None, please_note=None, price_ranges=None, promoter=None, sales=None, units=None, url=None, venues=None)¶

Bases: object

Ticketmaster event

The JSON returned from the Discovery API (at least, as far as what’s being used here) looks like:

{
    "name": "Event name",
    "dates": {
        "start": {
            "localDate": "2019-04-01",
            "localTime": "2019-04-01T23:00:00Z"
        },
        "status": {
            "code": "onsale"
        }
    },
    "classifications": [
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Rock"
            }
        },
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Funk"
            }
        }
    ],
    "priceRanges": [
        {
            "min": 10,
            "max": 25
        }
    ],
    "_embedded": {
        "venues": [
            {
                "name": "The Tabernacle"
            }
        ]
    }
}
static from_json(json_event)¶

Creates an Event from API’s JSON response

class ticketpy.model.Venue(accessible_seating_detail=None, additional_info=None, address=None, box_office_info=None, city=None, country=None, currency=None, description=None, distance=None, dmas=None, general_info=None, images=None, links=None, locale=None, location=None, markets=None, name=None, parking_detail=None, postal_code=None, social=None, state=None, test=None, timezone=None, type=None, units=None, url=None, venue_id=None)¶

Bases: object

A Ticketmaster venue

The JSON returned from the Discovery API looks something like this (edited for brevity):

{
    "id": "KovZpaFEZe",
    "name": "The Tabernacle",
    "url": "http://www.ticketmaster.com/venue/115031",
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "address": {
        "line1": "152 Luckie Street"
    },
    "city": {
        "name": "Atlanta"
    },
    "postalCode": "30303",
    "state": {
        "stateCode": "GA",
        "name": "Georgia"
    },
    "country": {
        "name": "United States Of America",
        "countryCode": "US"
    },
    "location": {
        "latitude": "33.758688",
        "longitude": "-84.391449"
    },
    "social": {
        "twitter": {
            "handle": "@TabernacleATL"
        }
    },
    "markets": [
        {
            "id": "10"
        }
    ]
}

Returns a Venue object from JSON
